message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to these 10 statements about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Israel. I should provide thoughtful responses based on reasonable perspectives about AI in educational settings.

Let me think through each statement:

[TT4G35A]: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is a reasonable positive use case. AI can indeed help with brainstorming and improving lesson plans. I would say "Agree" - this is a legitimate positive application.

[TT4G35B]: "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - This is also a positive use case. AI can help with differentiation and personalization. I would say "Agree" - this is a valuable capability.

[TT4G35C]: "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - This is about personalized support. This is a positive use case. I would say "Agree" - AI can help provide individualized support at scale.

[TT4G35D]: "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - This is another positive use case, particularly for accessibility and inclusion. I would say "Agree" - this is an important application.

[TT4G35E]: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - This is a very reasonable positive use case. Administrative tasks are time-consuming and AI could help. I would say "Strongly agree" - this is clearly a beneficial application.

[TT4G35F]: "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is a negative statement about academic integrity. This is a real concern with AI. I would say "Agree" - this is a legitimate concern, though it's more about misuse than inherent capability.

[TT4G35G]: "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - This is a concern about AI accuracy and appropriateness. This is a valid concern. 

AI systems can make errors and provide unsuitable recommendations, so I'd say "Agree" here.

[TT4G35H]: "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - This is about bias in AI systems. This is a known concern. I would say "Agree" - this is a documented risk with AI systems.

[TT4G35I]: "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - This is about data security and privacy. This is a valid concern. I would say "Agree" - using AI systems can pose risks to student data privacy and security.

[TT4G35J]: "Artificial intelligence suggests..." - I need to see the complete statement to respond appropriately.
